SENT.plain: Pulmonary artery aneurysms due to Behçet's disease are mainly seen in young males and very rarely in females
To our knowledge there are only 10 cases reported in the related literature

Emergent transcatheter embolization was performed in a female patient with a known history of Behçet's disease in whom massive hemoptysis developed because of rupture of a giant pulmonary artery aneurysm
At 6-month follow-up, transformation of the aneurysm sac into an air cavity was detected
To our knowledge, such a transformation has never been reported in the literature before
Embolization of the pulmonary artery aneurysm and the mechanism of cavity transformation are reviewed and discussed
